question: Why is my internet slow?
answer: Slow internet can be caused by several factors: too many devices connected, outdated equipment, WiFi interference, or network congestion. Try restarting your modem/router first. If the problem persists, call us at (347) 519-9999 for technical support.

question: My internet isn't working, what do I do?
answer: First, try restarting your modem and router by unplugging them for 30 seconds, then plugging them back in. Wait 2-3 minutes for them to fully restart. If that doesn't work, call us at (347) 519-9999 for immediate technical support.
keywords: internet not working down offline problem

question: How do I restart my modem and router?
answer: To restart: 1) Unplug the power cable from your modem and router. 2) Wait 30 seconds. 3) Plug the modem back in first and wait for all lights to stabilize (about 2 minutes). 4) Then plug in the router. Wait another minute for everything to reconnect.

question: How do I change my WiFi password?
answer: To change your WiFi password, you'll need to log into your router's admin panel (usually at 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1). If you need help with this, call us at (347) 519-9999 and we'll walk you through it.

question: My WiFi signal is weak, what can I do?
answer: Weak WiFi can be improved by: 1) Moving your router to a central location. 2) Reducing interference from other devices. 3) Upgrading to a better router. 4) Adding WiFi extenders. Call (347) 519-9999 and we can help optimize your WiFi!
